SystemHScrollBar and SystemVScrollBar controls are used to provide easy navigation through a long list of items or a large amount of information by scrolling either horizontally or vertically within an application or control.
For more information please see the Components - SystemScrollBar topic.

Initializes a new SDUFormattedString object with given string and initial CharacterFormat.
Format string definition is at documentation for member.

member.name: M:PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.WrapLines(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds newline characters to wrap lines to fit given width.
member.remarks:
This method adds characters into SDUFormattedString so every Position and Interval structures becomes invalid.
This method is called by StringDrawUtils to wrap lines to fit a rectangle.

member.name: M:PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.WrapSingleLine(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single,PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.Interval,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Adds newline characters into single line to make it fit given width.
member.remarks:
This function changes character numbers of SDUFormattedString so every user Position and Interval structures becomes invalid.
Also as we save positions of newly added newline characters, WrapSingleLine calls must go from left to right - to not damage previously saved positions.

member.summary: Draws string into specified rectangle using given ParagraphFormat.
member.remarks:
This is the 'main' method of the class. This one is called by StringDrawUtils to draw formatted string.
As this class (and consequently this method) isn't to be published, there are some limitations:
Angle of InitialFormat (specified at construction) has to be zero.
BackgroundBrush

member.summary: Returns true if this Position struct points at the first character.

member.name: M:PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.Position.Next
member.summary: Moves the position struct one character further.
member.remarks: Of course this is not posible at the end of string, so in this case an exception is thrown. (Wanting to do this means there's some bug.)

member.name: M:PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.Position.Back
member.summary: Moves the position struct one character backward.
member.remarks: Of course this is not posible at the beginning of string, so in this case an exception is thrown. (Wanting to do this means there's some bug.)

member.name: M:PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.Position.op_Addition(PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.Position,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the Position struct by characters forward (or -ofs backward, if ofs is negative).
member.returns: If moving out of the string margins would be result of this method, an exception is thrown. (Wanting to do this means there's some bug.)

member.name: M:PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.Position.op_Subtraction(PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.Position,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the Position struct by characters backward (or -ofs forward, if ofs is negative).
member.returns: If moving out of the string margins would be result of this method, an exception is thrown. (Wanting to do this means there's some bug.)

member.name: M:PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.Position.op_Subtraction(PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.Position,PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.Position)
member.summary: Returns the number of characters between given Position objects. (Eg. (a+2)-a==2)

member.summary: Index of piece in parent's array.

member.summary: Index of character in piece string.

member.name: P:PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.Position.Parent
member.summary: SDUFormattedString object that this struct points into.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.SDUFormattedString.Interval
member.summary: This struct can contain an interval in SDUFormattedString.
member.remarks:
The interval is represented as two positions - position of it's first character () and position of the first character not contained in this interval ().
If Start==End, the interval is empty.

member.name: M:PureComponents.EntrySet.RoundRectUtils.StrokeOutConvexRegion(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Region,System.Drawing.Color,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws one-pixel line around region border. As some optimalisations are used, the has to be convex - otherwise the line might be drawn incorrectly.
member.param: to stroke out. It has to be convex - otherwise result might be drawn incorrectly.
If true, pixels will be drawn inside the , otherwise outside.
member.remarks: The more rectangular shape of the region is, the faster will this method work. It goes through all noncontained pixels in bounding rectangle of specified region. (Because region is convex, we can easily skip the contained ones.)

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Lists.DropDownControl
member.summary: EntrySet DropDownControl represents advanced button control with several rendering styles including Vista like look&feel with easy and flexible style settings and ability to show several commands in a dropdown menu.
member.remarks:
The DropDownControl control allows the user to click on it to perform an action. Unlike Button the list of commands can be displayed on the right side by the click on the arrow.
For more information please see the Components - DropDownControl topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.GroupBox
member.summary: EntrySet GroupBox unlike basic WinForms GroupBox has ability to set individual look of panel and header parts, use shape, colors and fill styles to create better looking group boxes.
member.remarks:
GroupBox controls are used to provide an identifiable grouping for other controls. Typically, you use group boxes to subdivide form by function. Grouping all options in a group box gives the user a logical visual cue.
For more information please see the Components - GroupBox topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.ContainerPanel
member.summary: EntrySet ContainerPanel is a container (panel) control with flexible style settings like shape and fill styles.
member.remarks:
ContainerPanel controls are used to provide an identifiable grouping for other controls. Typically, you use panels to subdivide a form by function. Grouping all options in a panel gives the user a logical visual cue. At ContainerPanel you can set the color, background fill, frame color and its style.
For more information please see the Components - ContainerPanel topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32
member.summary: Class encapsulating Win32 API calls.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues
member.summary: Values to pass to the GetDCEx method.

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.Window
member.summary: DCX_WINDOW: Returns a DC that corresponds to the window rectangle rather than the client rectangle.

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.Cache
member.summary: DCX_CACHE: Returns a DC from the cache, rather than the OWNDC or CLASSDC window. Essentially overrides CS_OWNDC and CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.NoResetAttrs
member.summary: DCX_NORESETATTRS: Does not reset the attributes of this DC to the default attributes when this DC is released.

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ClipChildren
member.summary: DCX_CLIPCHILDREN: Excludes the visible regions of all child windows below the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ClipSiblings
member.summary: DCX_CLIPSIBLINGS: Excludes the visible regions of all sibling windows above the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ParentClip
member.summary: DCX_PARENTCLIP: Uses the visible region of the parent window. The parent's WS_CLIPCHILDREN and CS_PARENTDC style bits are ignored. The origin is set to the upper-left corner of the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ExcludeRgn
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDERGN: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is excluded from the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.IntersectRgn
member.summary: DCX_INTERSECTRGN: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is intersected with the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.ExcludeUpdate
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDEUPDATE: Unknown...Undocumented

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.IntersectUpdate
member.summary: DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE: Unknown...Undocumented

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.LockWindowUpdate
member.summary: DCX_LOCKWINDOWUPDATE: Allows drawing even if there is a LockWindowUpdate call in effect that would otherwise exclude this window. Used for drawing during tracking.

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.Common.Win32.DeviceContextValues.Validate
member.summary: DCX_VALIDATE When specified with DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE, causes the DC to be completely validated. Using this function with both DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE and DCX_VALIDATE is identical to using the BeginPaint function.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.TabControl
member.summary: EntrySet TabControl represents the tab control with advanced customizable rendering with several shapes to choose from (XP, Rounded etc.) and fill styles (Vista, Fading etc.).
member.remarks:
The TabControl displays multiple tabs, like dividers in a notebook or labels in a set of folders in a filing cabinet. The tabs can contain pictures and other controls.
For more information please see the Components - TabControl topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.RichListBox
member.summary: EntrySet RichListBox is advanced listbox control with functionality like shapes, colors, fillstyles (including Vista like rendering) and formatted text rendering (richtext) for its items.
member.remarks:
A RichListBox control displays a list of items from which the user can select one or more. Unlike regular ListBox the rich text formatting can be used.
For more information please see the Components - RichListBox topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.ComboBox
member.summary: EntrySet ComboBox is a combobox control with flexible style settings like shape, several attractive and modern fill styles and Vista look&feel drop down list.
member.remarks:
The ComboBox control is used to display data in a drop-down combo box. By default, the ComboBox control appears in two parts: the top part is a text box that allows the user to type a list item. The second part is a list box that displays a list of items from which the user can select one.
For more information please see the Components - ComboBox topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.Header
member.summary: EntrySet Header is a control typically used in upper part of a form on wizard like dialog boxes.
member.remarks:
Header control can display different types of headers and footers for all the windows, forms and panels. You can set its size, color and background fill. It is also possible to set type and color of lines and borders, which highlights the header.
For more information please see the Components - Header topic.

The RichComboBox control is used to display data in a drop-down combo box. Unlike ComboBox the rich text formatting can be used.
For more information please see the Components - RichComboBox topic.

Within seconds your forms look significantly nicer to look at, are better arranged and easier to use. Any control, including but not limited to TextBox or ComboBox etc, is enriched with painting of captions, shapes, titles, backgrounds, flags and more.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.Label
member.summary: EntrySet Label represents the label control with advanced style settings like shape, colors, borders and fill styles.
member.remarks:
Label controls are used to display text or images that cannot be edited by the user. They are used to identify objects on a form. Label has rich possibilities in look settings. You can set either text color and background color or different shapes, fill and frame types. Due to this has the Label wide range of utilization.
For more information please see the Components - Label topic.

member.summary: Specifies character formatting

member.summary: Font to be used for drawing strings.

member.summary: Brush to be used for drawing strings.

member.summary: Angle of string's rotation. (Clockwise)

member.summary: HotkeyPrefix of the string.

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.CharacterFormat.Formatted
member.summary: If true, some special sequences can be used in the string to change it's appearance.
member.remarks:
The formatting sequences are:
#CRRGGBB Changes color of the text. RR, GG and BB are hexadecimal values of appropriate color channels.
#C- Changes color of the text to the one before last use of #CRRGGBB command.
Can be used multiple times: #CFF0000 Red #C00FF00 Green #C0000FF Blue #C- Green #C- Red
#B+ and #B- Sets and unsets the bold font style.
#I+ and #I- Sets and unsets the italics font style.
#U+ and #U- Sets and unsets the underline font style.
## Writes the # character (as it is not possible to write it by '#' character).

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.CharacterFormat.FilledBounds
member.summary: Instead of characters, only bounding rectangles are drawn.
member.remarks: This is useful when resulting image is to be masked and at the same time text is drawn by several brushes.

member.name: F:PureComponents.EntrySet.CharacterFormat.IgnoreColorFormatting
member.summary: Color formattig marks will be ignored. (Applicable only when Formatted is true.)
member.remarks: This is useful when resulting image is to be used as mask and we want all the text to be drawn by same brush.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.EditBox
member.summary: EntrySet EditBox is flexible editbox with functionality like masked input and advanced and flexible style settings, use fill styles and shapes to create stunning input forms.
member.remarks:
Edit boxes are used to get input from the user or to display text. The EditBox control is generally used for editable text, although it can also be made read-only. Edit boxes can display multiple lines and wrap text to the size of the control. The EditBox control allows a single format for displayed or entered text in the control.
For more information please see the Components - EditBox topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.ControlHighlight
member.summary: ControlHighlight represents a control that can handle mouse movement and control focus events to modify control's style. Component is applicable to EntrySet EditBox, RichEditBox, ComboBox, RichComboBox and DatePicker.
member.remarks:
This control’s task is to highlight the controls in color, which have focus. It facilitates the orientation in forms. Also the control, above which the mouse is, can be differentiated in color.
For more information please see the Components - ControlHighlight topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.CommandButton
member.summary: EntrySet CommandButton represents advanced button control with several rendering styles including Vista like look&feel with easy and flexible style settings and ability to show several commands in a dropdown menu.
member.remarks:
The CommandButton control allows the user to click on it to perform an action. Unlike Button the list of commands can be displayed on the right side by the click on the arrow.
For more information please see the Components - CommandButton topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.SystemProgressBar
member.summary: EntrySet SystemProgressBar represents a Windows theme aware progress bar control.
member.remarks:
The SystemProgressBar control indicates the progress of an action by displaying an appropriate number of rectangles arranged in a horizontal bar. When the action is complete, the bar is filled.
For more information please see the Components - SystemProgressBar topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.DatePicker
member.summary: EntrySet DatePicker represents control to allow user pick a date from drop down calendar control.
member.remarks:
The DatePicker control allows the user to select a single item from a list of dates. It appears in two parts: a drop-down list with a date or time represented in text, and a grid that appears when you click on the down-arrow next to the list. The grid looks like the MonthCalendar control, which can be used for selecting date.
For more information please see the Components - DatePicker topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Extenders.ValidationExtender.ValidationExtender
member.summary: ValidationExtender helps developers with data entry validation. For any control on a form validation can be defined, which can consist of one or any number and combination of so called Validators. Next to typical validators for value comparison, datatype checks, regular expression etc there is special Condition validator that is able to validate value based on a formula and values from other controls.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.CheckBox
member.summary: CheckBox represents advanced checkbox control with attractive look&feel rendering including Glass or XP styles.
member.remarks:
The CheckBox control indicates whether a particular condition is on or off. It is commonly used to present a Yes/No or True/False selection to the user. Contrary to common Checkbox, in this Checkbox several themes are available and colors can be set at all the parts of the CheckBox.
For more information please see the Components - CheckBox topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.FormManager
member.summary: FormManager provides common style functionality for all EntrySet Controls components, provides Form Builder functionality in DesignMode and enables unified style settings.
member.remarks:
FormManager is special component, which provides Form Templates. Once you put FormManager on Form, you can start to use tens of Form Templates such as dialog boxes, entry forms, splash screens, and panels etc.By means of Form Templates you can create the applications faster and also inspire yourself with its look. Another function, which FormManager has, is centralized style setting. You create some style e.g. for EditBox and you assign this style to all the EditBox on the form. If you want to change the color of all the EditBox, change it in FormManager.
For more information please see the Components - FormManager topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Lists.ContainerPanel
member.summary: EntrySet ContainerPanel is a container (panel) control with flexible style settings like shape and fill styles.
member.remarks:
ContainerPanel controls are used to provide an identifiable grouping for other controls. Typically, you use panels to subdivide a form by function. Grouping all options in a panel gives the user a logical visual cue. At ContainerPanel you can set the color, background fill, frame color and its style.
For more information please see the Components - ContainerPanel topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.RadioButton
member.summary: RadioButton represents advanced radio button control with attractive look&feel rendering including Glass or XP styles.
member.remarks:
RadioButton controls present a set of two or more mutually exclusive choices to the user. While radio buttons and check boxes may appear to function similarly, there is an important difference: when a user selects a radio button, the other radio buttons in the same group cannot be selected as well. Unlike radiobutton several themes are available and the colors of all the parts of RadioButton can be set.
For more information please see the Components - RadioButton topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.Button
member.summary: EntrySet Button represents advanced button control with several rendering styles including Vista like look&feel with easy and flexible style settings.
member.remarks:
The Button control allows the user to click on it to perform an action. You can choose from several themes, which determine the look and the shape of the button. An interesting theme is e.g. Vista where the button is grey on its initial level but when you point on it by mouse it colors. It is possible to set the color and the fill of the button’s background and text.
For more information please see the Components - Button topic.

For more information please see the Components - SystemScrollBar topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Extenders.ValidationExtender.RegionalSettings
member.summary: RegionalSettings contains data for settings of datetime entries and floating points conversions. When developping an application there might be the need to have the specific format of data (due to some requirements from database and so on) that are dependant on regional settings. These are DateTime and Floating point datatypes. For such cases ValidationExtender contains this RegionalSetting object that allows you to specify the proper Date and Floating point format you wish.

member.name: M:PureComponents.EntrySet.Extenders.ValidationExtender.RegionalSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Construction

member.name: M:PureComponents.EntrySet.Extenders.ValidationExtender.RegionalSettings.ToString
member.summary: Overridden.

member.name: P:PureComponents.EntrySet.Extenders.ValidationExtender.RegionalSettings.DateTimePattern
member.summary: Pattern for the date time parsing operations. Format definition string is the same as for typical DateTime.ToString or DateTime.Parse functions. For example string dd.MM.yyyy shows date of 1st of September 2005 like 01.09.2005. For more format string samples check the DateTime.Parse function.

member.name: P:PureComponents.EntrySet.Extenders.ValidationExtender.RegionalSettings.DatePattern
member.summary: Pattern for the date parsing operations. Format definition string is the same as for typical DateTime.ToString or DateTime.Parse functions. For example string dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm shows date of 1st of September 2005 and 2pm 30 minutes like 01.09.2005 14:30. For more format string samples check the DateTime.Parse function.

member.name: P:PureComponents.EntrySet.Extenders.ValidationExtender.RegionalSettings.TimePattern
member.summary: Pattern for the time parsing operations. Format definition string is the same as for typical DateTime.ToString or DateTime.Parse functions. For example string HH:mm shows time of 2pm 30 minutes like 14:30. For more format string samples check the DateTime.Parse function.

member.name: P:PureComponents.EntrySet.Extenders.ValidationExtender.RegionalSettings.DecimalSeparator
member.summary: Decimal separator for double parsing operations. Character defining decimal separator used in double.Parse function.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.Divider
member.summary: Divider represents a line control like control which can be used to divide controls and information on a form to create more understandable and easier to use user interface.
member.remarks:
Divider is control, which displays the horizontal or vertical line in different styles. It can be used to divide different parts of the form according to its function. It can be also used for decorative purposes.
For more information please see the Components - Divider topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.RichLabel
member.summary: EntrySet RichLabel is advanced rich text rendering control. Use this control to show formatted text in flexible and easy to use way, there is no more any need to hassle with RTF formatting and complicated structures. Integrated design-time WYSIWYG editor simplifies usage even more.
member.remarks:
RichLabel has rich possibilities in look settings as Label and besides that the rich text formatting can be used.
For more information please see the Components - RichLabel topic.

member.name: T:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.RichEditBox
member.summary: EntrySet RichEditBox is advanced rich text rendering and input control. Use this control to enter and edit formatted text in flexible and easy to use way, there is no more any need to hassle with RTF formatting and complicated structures. Integrated design-time WYSIWYG editor simplifies usage even more.
member.remarks:
RichEditBox control is same as EditBox and besides that the rich text formatting can be used. All of this makes it the ideal component for notes and memos.
For more information please see the Components - RichEditBox topic.

member.name: M:PureComponents.EntrySet.Controls.RichEditBox.FindString(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds given string starting search at index specified by .
member.param: This parameter receives index of first character of given string.
This parameter receives length of found string (to be used eg. in property.
member.returns: Returns true if search was successful.
member.remarks: Returned length of string can be greater or equal than length of given string. It's greater when inside of the found string there are some format informations contained (eg. when half of the string is bold and the other not, in the middle of it there's an information saying that).
